since_last_update: Dominant macro shock remains the Trump Greenland/tariff escalation: proposed additional 10% tariffs on eight European countries starting Feb 1, with rhetoric about further escalation if no deal (Reuters).

Cross-asset signal flagged in prior state persists: equities sold off while long-end yields rose in the Tuesday risk-off move, tightening financial conditions and pressuring duration-heavy equities (AP).
Safe-haven bid intensified: gold extended to fresh record highs as uncertainty around trade/geopolitics rose (AP).
Tape is now explicitly “event-driven” into Davos headline risk: US index futures steadied after the prior session’s sharp selloff with focus on Trump’s Davos remarks (Reuters).
today_focus: Primary driver check (dominant narrative): trade/geopolitical risk premium around Trump/Davos + Greenland-linked tariff threats; this is the clearest cross-asset catalyst for ES/NQ risk tone and gold safe-haven demand today (Reuters, AP).

Rates sensitivity remains the key transmission mechanism for NQ: the recent pattern of weaker equities alongside higher long-end yields raises risk of valuation compression (especially if tariffs are reframed as inflationary) (AP).

Gold focus: positioning risk is two-sided—safe-haven momentum is strong on headlines, but any de-escalation/détente headline can quickly unwind the premium; watch USD/yields impulse as secondary drivers (AP, Reuters).
Earnings are a secondary but live driver for index dispersion today (large-cap reports/outlooks); risk is that guidance uncertainty compounds the macro shock (Barron's, AP).

dominant_driver.driver: Political/trade-risk repricing tied to Greenland dispute and tariff threats; event-risk into Davos speech

what_seems_priced: Higher near-term risk premium (gap risk) for US equities from policy headlines; elevated sensitivity to any additional tariff timetable details or retaliation signals (Reuters, AP).
Greater downside convexity for growth/tech (Nasdaq) versus defensives after the sharp selloff (AP).
what_may_be_underpriced: Risk of a sustained adverse regime (equities down + yields up) if tariffs are interpreted as inflationary and/or if term premium rises further; this is particularly toxic for NQ (AP).
Second-order retaliation/fragmentation risk (EU countermeasures) that turns a headline shock into a multi-week earnings/margin story (Reuters).

what_seems_priced: Near-term Fed hold remains the base case (policy path not the immediate mover versus politics), but the market is highly reactive to any inflation channel narrative from tariffs (inference; anchored by Reuters/AP reporting on tariff-driven risk sentiment).
what_may_be_underpriced: Tail risk that institutional credibility/independence headlines (Fed governance/legal/political) bleed into term premium; currently a low-visibility but potentially high-impact channel (Barron's).

what_seems_priced: Meaningful geopolitical/trade uncertainty premium (record-high behavior consistent with safe-haven impulse) (AP).
what_may_be_underpriced: Whipsaw risk: a single conciliatory headline could compress safe-haven demand faster than macro fundamentals change (inference; consistent with event-driven setup described by Reuters/AP).

risk_register.risk: Headline-gap risk around Trump/Davos remarks: tariff scope/timing, EU retaliation rhetoric, or Greenland framing driving abrupt risk-on/risk-off swings (Reuters, AP).
Adverse cross-asset regime: equities weaken while long-end yields rise (valuation compression, tighter financial conditions), disproportionately impacting Nasdaq/long-duration equities (AP).
Gold reversal risk if de-escalation headlines emerge; alternatively further extension if narrative shifts to stagflation/trade-war escalation (AP, Reuters).
Macro override risk: upcoming US inflation/activity data (Core PCE, PMIs) re-anchor real rates and overwhelm politics-driven tape (calendar; consistent with prior-state sensitivity).
Earnings-guidance uncertainty amplifies macro shock (index-level dispersion and factor rotations), especially if companies cite trade policy or cost uncertainty (Barron's, AP).

event_warnings: Trump speech timing risk: expect volatility clustering into/after remarks (scheduled Jan 21, 2026 16:30 ET per provided calendar; consistent with Davos focus in Reuters/AP).
Jan 21 10:00 ET: Pending Home Sales (medium) — can add noise to rates-sensitive tape but likely secondary to geopolitical headline risk today (provided calendar).
Jan 22: Jobless Claims + Final GDP (high) — combined growth check can move front-end expectations and spill into equity duration (provided calendar).

Jan 22: Core PCE m/m (high) — the main macro catalyst this week; upside surprise would likely pressure NQ via real-rate repricing while keeping gold bid via uncertainty channel (provided calendar; inference on transmission).
Jan 23: Flash PMIs (high) — growth vs prices mix risk; can flip the market between ‘growth scare’ and ‘sticky inflation’ regimes quickly (provided calendar).
